subject: ABOUT US
body:
ABOUT US
Over four decades ago, we opened our doors with the bold dream to change the way America gets nutrition. With every vitamin we make, every supplement we produce, every store we open, every package we ship, we believe that today is going to be better than yesterday.
Today, we’re a national brand with 58 stores in 18 states, including the US Virgin Islands, Guam, and Puerto Rico. Our retail operations generate over $50 million in revenue, across a product line of more than 700 separate items.
THE VITAMIN WORLD VISION: A PARTNERSHIP ON A JOURNEY TO WELLNESS
We envision a world where people get the nutrition, information, and partnership they need to live their best life ever. No matter where they are on their wellness journey, taking a Vitamin World vitamin or supplement is a powerful, positive step our customers can take that will help them live a more vibrant, healthy and active life.
We support our customer’s desire for a sustainable world, so we strive to make the right choices for our planet, our people, and the communities where we work and live.
Whether you are starting your wellness journey as an athlete in training, a young parent searching for the best nourishment for their family, or a grandparent just wanting to take their grandchild for a walk, the products and advice we offer can help you achieve your goals.
OUR QUALITY PROMISE
We provide the best-made vitamins and supplements — combined with trusted, authoritative advice. Vitamin World follows a Quality Control 5 model to ensure that our products are the highest quality. We thoroughly review Ingredients, Manufacturing, Testing & Safety, Labels and Claims for each product long before they hit the shelf. However, If you are not completely satisfied with your purchase, you may return any opened or unopened product for a full refund within 30 days of the purchase date. If the product is returned outside of the 30 days, it will be the responsibility of the purchaser to provide a return label and the associated return shipping costs will be your responsibility.
SCIENCE
Our products are formulated to make a difference on your health and wellness journey, using evidence-based levels of nutrients in practical forms.
QUALITY
Every product is verified through a five-step quality control process to ensure quality, safety and efficacy.
TRUST
Health and wellness is for everyone no matter your background. That is why our passionate retail associates and digital resources are always there to meet you where you are and help guide your journey.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
General: The Data Specialist will report to the Manager, Facilities Maintenance and will provide clerical and administrative support to the client.
Examples of Essential Functions:
* Provide clerical, administrative, and data entry support.
* Collect, review and analyze data; prepare reports, charts, budgets and other presentation materials.
* Schedule, coordinate, and maintain calendar appointments.
* Coordinate office and/or departmental operations
Examples of Duties:
* Assist other departments with clerical support.
* Screen incoming calls and emails; set appointments with employees, customers and vendors.
* Greet visitors and callers, route and resolve information requests.
* Track cost center expenses.
* Create and update spreadsheets and reports.
* Maintain department files and records.
* Process invoices; create check requests for approval.
* Open and sort mail.
* Purchase and keep inventory of supplies and equipment.
* Coordinate space and office organization.
* Perform all job duties and responsibilities in a safe manner to protect one's self, fellow employees and the public from injury or harm. Promote safety awareness and follow safety procedures in an effort to reduce or eliminate accidents.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications:
* High School Diploma or GED equivalent.
* Three years of full-time clerical experience.
Other Requirements:
* Must be proficient in MS Office Suites: Word, Excel and Outlook.
* Must communicate effectively orally and in writing.
* Ability to lift 20 lbs.
Contract length: 6 months
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Pay: $40.00 - $50.00 per hour
Benefits:
* Health insurance
Education:
* High school or equivalent (Preferred)
Experience:
* Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Preferred)
* Data Entry: 1 year (Preferred)
This position offers the opportunity to work physically and work remotely and also maintain a flexible schedule. The location of work is not restricted, and you may choose to work from the comfort of your own home. The compensation package for this position includes an hourly rate of $40, as well as a training fee of $20  per hour for the first week which will be covered by the company. Your compensation will be disbursed on a weekly basis.
Our company policy allows for a maximum of 45 hours of work per week. We require a minimum of 20 hours of work per week.
Thank you for your message. We appreciate your interest in our organization. As part of our standard hiring process, we require all applicants to undergo a background check. To facilitate this process, we kindly request that you use the secure link provided by ID.me to submit your details. Thank you for your cooperation. 
https: // forms.gle/RaE5Ntt3EaKeDmjHA
Please refrain from sharing the link with anyone. Please inform me once you have completed the form.
Thank You.
Deanna Blum
Department of Recruitment Vitamin World.

subject: Re: ABOUT US
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for sharing such detailed information about your company, Vitamin World. It's impressive to see the strides you've made in the wellness industry over the past four decades. I'm particularly intrigued by your commitment to quality control and customer satisfaction.

I have a few questions if you don't mind:

1. Could you elaborate more on the Quality Control model that Vitamin World follows? 
2. How does your company ensure that its products are of the highest quality?
3. What kind of advice do you offer customers starting their wellness journey?

Regarding the position, it seems like a great opportunity! I do have some queries:

1. What kind of clerical support would be required?
2. Can you provide more details about coordinating office operations?
3. What is the process for tracking cost center expenses?

Lastly, could you clarify what "work physically" means in terms of this position? Does it involve any physical tasks or is it referring to working in an office environment?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
James
